title: Jennifer Aniston on 'powerful' new drama The Morning Show
text:
Jennifer Aniston stars as journalist Alex Levy in the new serial (Picture: Apple TV+)

Jennifer Aniston has opened up about her leading role in her ‘powerful’ new series The Morning Show.

The Friends star shares the screen alongside fellow icons Reese Witherspoon and Steve Carrell in the drama, which takes us behind the scenes of America’s highest rated breakfast news show in the Me Too era.

Aniston stars as Alex Levy, the anchor of the programme. When her co-star (Carell) is fired thanks to a sexual misconduct scandal, Levy must fight to keep her job and has to stave off a hungry journalist (Witherspoon) who wants to replace her.

Aniston co-stars with Reece Witherspoon in the ‘powerful’ new serial (Picture: Apple TV+)

Speaking to Variety, Aniston shared her thoughts on the landmark serial, which will be the first content released on new streaming service and Netflix rival Apple TV+.

‘Reese and I feel so proud,’ she said. ‘That we’re part of launching a new network. Being the first show for Apple and they’re such extraordinary partners and there’s a lot of women that are involved in this.’

Aniston singled out praise for the showrunner Kerry Ehrin, who she said created a ‘gorgeous’ world for the new characters to inhabit.

‘I’ve never read material like she’s written,’ the Murder Mystery actress enthused. ‘It’s so raw, it’s so beautiful, it’s so messy. It’s powerful.’

The star recently reunited with her Friends castmates (Picture: Getty)

The star also recently broke the internet when she shared a selfie with Friends co-stars Matt LeBlanc and Courtney Cox. In even more exciting news, she revealed that all of the main cast of the legendary sitcom had actually reunited last week.

Is the long-awaited reunion finally happening?

The Morning Show launches on Apple TV+ November 1.
